intro: Seriphidium tauricum, commonly known as the Crimean tarragon, is a flowering plant native to the steppes of southern Russia and Ukraine. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, gray-green leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Seriphidium tauricum is often used in traditional medicine and has a distinctive, slightly bitter aroma similar to tarragon.
